name: Grant's Zebra
description: The distinguishing feature of Grant’s Zebra, one of the most abundant zebra subspecies, is its wide dark stripes on a white background, extending into the mane.
image_alt: Grant's Zebra, photo: Tereza Mrhálková, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 220–250 cm, tail length 47–57 cm, shoulder height 110–140 cm, weight 170–320 kg
reproduction: The female is pregnant for 12 months and gives birth to 1 foal.
attractions: It is a subspecies of the plains zebra, found up to 4,500 m above sea level, though most commonly in lower savanna and bush areas near water.
breeding: Prague Zoo has kept Grant’s Zebras in two phases: 1949–1970 and since 2004. In the first phase, 15 foals were bred.
